images.copyright: A lion cub and mother in Sabi Sabi Game Reserve, South Africa (© Andrew Coleman/Getty Images)
images.title: Who said bears do all the hugging?
images.caption: National Hug Day
images.desc: Even the toughest predator on the South African savannah can get snuggly, especially on Hugging Day. Founded 35 years ago, this celebration of the embrace is meant to lift spirits during the post-holiday lull, encouraging family and friends to hug each other more often, not only today but every day. So, what are you waiting for? Go hug people!
images.bsTitle: Who said bears do all the hugging?
